data.title: Champions League draw in full as Arsenal and Man City learn quarter-final opponents
data.meta_description: The Champions League quarter-final draw has been conducted with both Arsenal and Manchester City handed glamorous ties.
data.text:
The Champions League quarter-final draw has been conducted with both Arsenal and Manchester City handed glamorous ties.

By Charlie Malam

Link copied Bookmark

A thrilling Champions League quarter-final draw sees Arsenal - in this round of the competition for the first time since 2009-10 - take on Harry Kane's Bayern Munich. The ex-Tottenham striker will return to London to face the Gunners with the England captain looking to win the first major trophy of his career, and Arsenal chasing their first ever European Cup triumph.

Arsenal have lost their last three games against Bayern all 5-1, and they'll be desperate for revenge against the Germans. But the Bundesliga champions will not have any fans at the Emirates due to a UEFA ban.

Holders Manchester City are reunited with 14-time winners Real Madrid in a heavyweight contest. City thrashed the Spanish giants 5-1 on aggregate in last year's semi-finals courtesy of a 4-0 victory at the Etihad, and they'll be away from home first in this tie too.

Their 4-0 rout of Los Blancos was one of the greatest Champions League performances of all time but their opponents will be hopeful of revenge. They have Jude Bellingham - one of the most in-form players in world football - in their side now.

Elsewhere, Barcelona - who are waving goodbye to manager Xavi at the end of the season - take on PSG, who are doing likewise with star man Kylian Mbappe. The other tie sees Borussia Dortmund travel to Atletico Madrid hoping to do what Inter Milan couldn't.

Recap the Champions League quarter-final draw with Express Sport below...

5 months ago11:34 Charlie Malam

What a draw!

That's all for this blog. What a Champions League quarter-final round we have to look forward to.

Let us know who you think will make it to the semi-finals, and the final, in the comments below.

We'll also be finding out the draw for the Europa League quarter-finals at 12. Express Sport is covering the draw live.

5 months ago11:27 Charlie Malam

Bayern fans BANNED from Arsenal match

If you didn't know, Bayern Munich fans are actually banned from attending the match against Arsenal at the Emirates next month.

The first leg will take place in London but there will be no away end of German supporters.

That's because UEFA have punished the Bavarians for their supporters throwing fireworks onto the pitch during their 3-1 win at Lazio earlier this month.

5 months ago11:20 Charlie Malam

Quarter-final fixture dates

Wow. What a draw that is.

Whoever gets to the final from the half that Arsenal, Bayern Munich, Real Madrid and Manchester City are in will fancy their chances of winning it.

But before we look ahead to the semis and the final, that quarter-final line-up is absolutely blockbuster.

The first legs will take place April 9 and April 10.

The second legs will be held a week later on April 16 and April 17.

5 months ago11:18 Charlie Malam

Who the 'home' team will be in the final

So it is semi-final one who will be the home team in the final at Wembley.

That means Atletico Madrid, Borussia Dortmund, PSG or Barcelona will be at 'home'.

They will face one of Arsenal, Bayern Munich, Real Madrid or Man City in the final.

5 months ago11:16 Charlie Malam

Champions League semi-final path

And this is how the semis will look.

Atletico Madrid or Borussia Dortmund vs PSG or Barcelona

Arsenal or Bayern Munich vs Real Madrid or Man City

5 months ago11:15 Charlie Malam

Champions League quarter-final draw in full

Arsenal vs Bayern Munich

Atletico Madrid vs Borussia Dortmund

Real Madrid vs Man City

PSG vs Barcelona

5 months ago11:14 Charlie Malam

PSG vs Barcelona

And that leaves us with...

PSG vs Barcelona.

5 months ago11:13 Charlie Malam

Real Madrid vs Manchester City

Next up...

Real Madrid - the most successful team in the history of this competition with 14 titles.

And they'll face Manchester City, the current holders of the trophy.

5 months ago11:12 Charlie Malam

Atletico Madrid vs Borussia Dortmund

And now the second tie.

Atletico Madrid are at home first.

The three-time runners-up will play... Borussia Dortmund.

5 months ago11:11 Charlie Malam

Arsenal vs Bayern Munich

Here we go!

The first team out are Arsenal.

They'll play... Bayern Munich. It's a reunion with ex-Tottenham striker Harry Kane for the Gunners.

5 months ago11:09 Charlie Malam

Nearly underway

John Obi Mikel says he hopes an English team make the Champions League final - mentioning Arsenal despite his Chelsea connections. That'll go down well.

Marchetti gives us a quick reminder of the draw rules, and in just a minute, we'll begin...

5 months ago11:05 Charlie Malam

Mr Marchetti is here

After a montage to remind us who the eight teams in this draw are... here he is, Mr Marchetti himself!

He gives us a lengthy talk to camera before introducing a special guest to the stage - ex-Chelsea midfielder John Obi Mikel.

5 months ago10:57 Charlie Malam

About to begin

We're about to get underway in Nyon, Switzerland.

Everybody ready to find out how UEFA drag this out for 15 minutes before it starts? Us too...

Bring on the man, the myth, the legend - Giorgio Marchetti!

5 months ago10:49 Charlie Malam

Last proper Champions League draw ever

Did you know? This is actually the last proper Champions League draw ever.

It will change to a tennis-style procedure next year and the new league table format of the Champions League means it would take three to four hours to conduct a draw as they do now.

Instead, computers will conduct the draw next season and it will not be televised.

5 months ago10:36 Charlie Malam

Who will win the Champions League?

The two English teams are the most likely to win this year's Champions League, according to the bookies.

Betfair price the quarter-finalists at...

Man City - 6/4

Arsenal - 4/1

Real Madrid - 9/2

Bayern Munich - 6/1

PSG - 11/1

Barcelona - 14/1

Atletico Madrid - 19/1

Dortmund - 25/1

5 months ago10:20 Charlie Malam

How the draw works

We're at the simple stage of the draw procedure now which means it is completely open - there is no seeding.

There are also no country restrictions meaning all-English, all-Spanish and all-German ties are possible.

The first team drawn will play its first match at home against the second team drawn.

The full bracket will be determined today, meaning we'll know a bit more clearly who could face each other in the semi-finals and the final.

5 months ago10:13 Charlie Malam

How the round of 16 went

Here's how the second legs of the Champions League round of 16 panned out...

Bayern Munich 3-0 Lazio (3-1 on agg)

Real Sociedad 1-2 PSG (1-4 on agg)

Real Madrid 1-1 RB Leipzig (2-1 on agg)

Man City 3-1 Copenhagen (6-2 on agg)

Arsenal 1-0 Porto (1-1 on agg, 4-2 on pens)

Barcelona 3-1 Napoli (4-2 on agg)

Borussia Dortmund 2-0 PSV (3-1 on agg)

Atletico Madrid 2-1 Inter Milan (2-2 on agg, 3-2 on pens)

5 months ago10:05 Charlie Malam

Who's in the draw?

Who are the eight teams in today’s draw, you ask?

Arsenal

Manchester City

Real Madrid

Bayern Munich

Barcelona

Borussia Dortmund

Atletico Madrid

PSG

Just the 27 combined European Cups then…

5 months ago09:56 Charlie Malam

Good morning!

Good morning! It's Friday, and it's draw day.

The Champions League quarter-final draw begins at 11am.

We'll have the standard 10 to 15 minutes of UEFA build-up before the balls are pulled out of the pot.
